channel.title: Information on CSE
channel.description: Recent content in Information on CSE

item.title: Links
item.description: As a student, you have free access to the complete suite of developer tools by JetBrains. Find out more here. For information on how to print a poster showcasing your project, look at this article on Poster Printing To activate Azure for students to get access to a suite of services to help you develop and deploy enterprise-grade web apps, among other things, sign in to your Taylor account here.

item.title: Poster Printing Services
item.description: THIS IS NOT THE TAYLOR PRINT SHOP. We cannot accept the discount coupons/forms that they provide. Please contact the University Press at x85218 or visit them (by the TU Post Office) if you have a coupon and need a poster printed. The CSE Dept is happy to provide large format printing for our students. We can print up to 42” wide by any length. New for 2017: We are using semi-gloss coated paper, which makes your prints look much nicer.

item.title: FAQ
item.description: FAQ How can I transfer my AP or dual credit classes? What’s a double major? Double majors are for people who are interested in studying more than one major. Taylor University allows students to declare any combination of minors and majors. Be sure that there is adequate overlap between the two majors so that you can finish in time! Also, be aware that there is a 160 credit hour cap.

item.title: COS120
item.description: COS 120 Introduction to Computational Problem Solving Approaches to computing solutions for problems from a variety of subject areas are examined and provide motivation for the study of the development of algorithms and their implementation. Programming concepts are introduced incrementally in order to solve increasingly complex problems. Good algorithm design and program structure are emphasized. Introductory data structures and software engineering principles are stressed. An introduction to object oriented programming is included.
